title: How to Ride a Two Wheeled Scooter

steps.title: Learn how to balance yourself.
steps.content: Learn how to balance yourself . Since the wheels on a two wheeled scooter are in front of each other, it doesn't balance correctly. Once you get the hang of balancing, you will be ready to ride the scooter. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Practise on an easier scooter.
steps.content: Practise on an easier scooter. This can improve your balance for when you ride a two wheeled scooter. Use scooters such as ones with three wheels. If you know how to ride a bike with two wheels, you may be able to practice on that.

steps.title: Unfold your scooter.
steps.content: Unfold your scooter. Some two wheeled scooters are folded when you take them out of the box. Unlock any lock that is in the scooter.

steps.title: Wear protective gear, such as a helmet, pads, etc.
steps.content: Wear protective gear, such as a helmet, pads, etc. [2] X Trustworthy Source Johns Hopkins Medicine Official resource database of the world-leading Johns Hopkins Hospital Go to source

steps.title: Make sure everything is working right on your scooter.
steps.content: Make sure everything is working right on your scooter .

steps.title: Place your hands on the handles of the two wheeled scooter.
steps.content: Place your hands on the handles of the two wheeled scooter . At the same time, place one of your legs on the bottom of the scooter. Keep your other leg down, and ready to push.

steps.title: Slowly push yourself with your leg that's on the ground.
steps.content: Slowly push yourself with your leg that's on the ground. Start off slow and later, go a little bit faster. This will prevent yourself from falling off the two wheeled scooter.

steps.title: Keep your balance.
steps.content: Keep your balance. Make sure you don't go too fast, or you may fall. Even though you have your gear on, you may still get hurt. Try forcing yourself not to fall, or when you are about to fall, change to a normal position for riding a two wheeled scooter and go slow. [3] X Research source Use this method if possible. If the scooter is tilting to the left, tilt yourself to the right. If the scooter is tilting to the right, tilt yourself to the left. Make sure you don't tilt yourself too hard, as this may result in you falling.

steps.title: Fully charge your scooter before riding.
steps.content: Fully charge your scooter before riding. Make sure you have enough range before you go. Electric scooters usually have 5 - 10 miles of range.

steps.title: Push the throttle button when you are moving fast enough and slowly speed up.
steps.content: Push the throttle button when you are moving fast enough and slowly speed up. It should be black and on the right side.

steps.title: Keep the right speed for your environment.
steps.content: Keep the right speed for your environment. Don't go fast on curves, bumpy and downhill surfaces.

steps.title: Slow down by:
steps.content: Slow down by: Coasting and then putting your foot down. (Recommended for stopping) Pressing the brake button. It should be red and on the left side. (Recommended for emergency stopping)

steps.title: If you're about to crash into an obstacle or lose your balance, press the brakes and stop immediately.
steps.content: If you're about to crash into an obstacle or lose your balance, press the brakes and stop immediately. [Image:Ride a Two Wheeled Scooter Step 15.jpg|center]] If you can't stop before crashing, jump off. You will probably trip and fall but it will be better than crashing because the scooter could launch you.
